noun.description: The state or feeling, often pleasant, of tiredness or inertia.
examples: he remembered the languor and warm happiness of those golden afternoons

noun.description: An oppressive stillness of the air.
examples: the afternoon was hot, quiet, and heavy with languor

origin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin, from languere (see languish). The original sense was illness, distress, later faintness, lassitude; current senses date from the 18th century, when such lassitude became associated with a romantic yearning.
